subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Miracles vs. Natural Law
description: A fast breakdown of Miracles vs. Natural Law for builders.

hook.text: Science says nature follows laws. Religion says God can break them. Miracles are the ultimate clash point.

buildup.text: David Hume argued that miracles violate natural law and should never be believed. His argument still dominates.

discovery.text: But natural laws describe what normally happens. They don't prescribe what must happen. Laws aren't limits on God.

twist.text: Lourdes has a medical bureau that investigates miracle claims. Of millions of claims, 70 have been certified.

climax.text: The miracle debate reveals what you already believe. Skeptics see coincidence. Believers see God. Evidence serves both.

punchline.text: Miracles reveal what you already believe. Evidence serves both sides.

quiz.question: What did David Hume argue about miracles?
options: They violate natural law and should never be believed
